attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Legal limit for clearance of the accidents and road re opening under 2 hours.
attributes.background:
23/08/2016 M27 closed FOR 6 HOURS! at Junction Two for Salisbury after caravan overturns on A31 near Cadnam. 
Excessive amount of work, Excessive shut down, Dangerous situation for public and the Nature on Diverted routs.
attributes.additional_details:
Road maintenance looks increasingly like a gravy train! Inefficiency is really spectacular ! They obviously sacrificed efficiency to illusion of safety. The question, how many accidents has happened on diverted routs? How many social and economic consequences from that careless inaction? How bad an congestion impact on nature? 
And it is everywhere, not only accidents. Why to limit 20 Ml of M3 from Heathrow to Fleet? We hear lots of words about infrastructure so far, but no action!

attributes.action: Make cycling in groups of over 6 a road traffic offence.
attributes.background: In the country side all weekend we are fed up of cyclists using our narrow lanes in large groups, this is incredibly dangerous to other road users, cars, horse riders, etc. They have very little regard or consideration for other people using the road.
attributes.additional_details: Getting very fed up of large groups of cyclists road racing with no stewards and no road closures with very little regard for other road users. If groups were limited to groups of 6 passing them down narrow lanes would be much safer for all.

attributes.action: Lower the 20% and bring back the 17.5% rate of VAT
attributes.background: Years ago the government raised VAT to 20 percent from 17.5 percent, when Great Britain ran out of money and the recession was looming. Years on, the Government has said time and time again we are out of a recession and jobs are at a record high. It's time to give families back their extra money.

attributes.action: Give prisoners the right to vote
attributes.background: The European Court of Human Rights has told the UK it is violating a human right by not allowing prisoners to vote.The Government is choosing to ignore this, however this is preventing a true democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/law/votes-prisoners-politics-versus-human-rights-law/

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Make it law to give bespoke acknowledgment & feedback to every job application
attributes.background: When applying for jobs, directly or via an agency, there's often no acknowledgment of application. If turned down, there's often no feedback. It's therefore not transparent & gives no chance to improve. We'd like a law to make employers acknowledge receipt & give short, bespoke feedback when asked.
attributes.additional_details:
Anecdotally, only 1 in 5 employers & agencies give acknowledgment of receipt. Of this, almost all give basic, generic reasons why you weren't interviewed. 
From interviews, only 1 in 2 potential employers give bespoke feedback. This means for every job applied for, you'll only get a clear reason you weren't considered for the role in around 1 in 40 occasions. 
How are you supposed to improve? We'd like a law to make employers give bespoke feedback of at least 100 words given when asked.

attributes.action: Teach sea safety in all costal schools.
attributes.background: We should make it mandatory for all costal schools to teach their pupils about sea safety, as they do in Australia, this information has the potential to save many many lives and should be taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Many people each year find themselves stuck in rip tides, most of which in this country have no idea of what a rip tide is, never mind what to do if ever caught in one, there is plenty of life saving information out there and without this information the worst could happen. In Australia most if not all children in costal school are taught about the dangers of the sea and how they could potentially avoid it, we should take note from this and apply it to our own schools, potentially saving lives.

attributes.action: We demand reform to the honours system to re-establish public trust
attributes.background: Honours nominations by the Prime Minister which are viewed as rewarding (i) financial donations to his/her party or (ii) private service to the Prime Minister and his/her close associates are corrosive of public trust in the political system.
attributes.additional_details: We demand reform of the honours system so that it reflects genuine public service and outstanding achievement as it is meant to do. The current honours committee structure is clearly not robust enough to achieve this. We demand democratic accountability of honours recommendations by the Prime Minister to be strengthened such that they can be scrutinised and/or blocked by Members of Parliament.

attributes.action: To Criminalize Ticket buying bots from buying up tickets for events
attributes.background: Ticket Buying bots should be criminalized and the practice made illegal. botnets are programmes which are used to target ticketing agents. They buy tickets at high speed and stop fans from being able to buy tickets at face value the tickets are then resold on other sites at greater value
attributes.additional_details:
For Example Harry potter tickets £15 pounds per part on the official website 
Stubhub ticket web site anything from £150 - £1750

attributes.action: Benefit sanctions must be stopped without exception.
attributes.background: Benefit sanctions are being handed out unlawfully.

attributes.action: home buyer's consumer rights must be protected better with tighter regulations.
attributes.background: The rights of the home buyer must be protected with more stringent regulations.  Consumer rights for home buyers must be implemented and enforced. Legislation must force builders to resolve items (floor area, design etc) prior to sale. stronger regulation must be enforced for after sale responses.
attributes.additional_details: I purchased a new build on help-to-buy from a reputable builder who benefitted (£600 million in bonuses alone) by miss-selling their houses. The floor space of the house is 6.5% less than advertised. The losses are significant based on the correlation of area to price.The NHBC guarantee provided for new homes must protect interests of the home buyer from the builders. This is a failing system. The advertised floor area and design must be proven before the sale with the right to cancellation.

attributes.action: Make it law for individuals to return footballs if they land on their property
attributes.background: 1000's of footballs are held hostage each year by individuals who assume rights to the ball once it lands on their property. As parents of a very keen footballer, this has cost us a small fortune over the years and we would like to ask government to address this very hazy and unclear subject.

attributes.action: Protect the original terms of students loans in statutory law
attributes.background: Students plan their financial future according to the terms of student loans.  The fragility of these terms was exposed by the recent freeze of the repayment threshold.  Prevent current and future governments betraying the trust of students with statutory protection of student loan terms.
attributes.additional_details: Student loans as of 2011/12 were based on a number of terms, including 9% rate of pay back over earning threshold of £21k, write-off of debt after 30 years. None of these terms are safeguarded in law meaning government can retrospectively change the terms of the loan, as evidenced to the recent freeze of earning threshold (see Alex True's petition). Imagine what an increase in the pay back rate would mean for your or your child's future. Google Sutton Trust's "Unfair deal" report.

attributes.action: Care homes all fitted with cameras
attributes.background: If pubs need cameras to prevent violence, then why haven't care homes got them? Nothing to hide? Then fit cameras in all care homes now, ideally connected to wifi so that relatives can look in at any time. Obviously beds and bathrooms need to be exempt but accessible by audio.
attributes.additional_details:
A camera with sound in every home where carers visit would also be a good idea, linked via Wi - Fi to anyone requiring access. Nothing to hide? Then nothing to worry about. 
 With an average of £1000 a week the cameras will not event make a dent in profits. 
Sign up now...You may be the next one to be treated badly in care.

attributes.action: Limit government special advisor severance pay to the minimum contract amount
attributes.background: Former Prime Minister David Cameron has overruled civil service advice so his special advisers get severance pay worth £282,000. This is contractually unnecessary and morally wrong at a time of public spending austerity. It smacks of cronyism and the money would be better spent on essential services

attributes.action: Don't Trigger Article 50 until at least after next US President takes office
attributes.background:
In deciding when UK should trigger Article 50, UK citizens demand that Government wait until next President of America has been elected & takes office. Triggering Article 50 should not be before 21 January 2017 
Future US Presidency could become protectionist. Benefits of Brexit could be tenuous
attributes.additional_details:
UK citizens are being told that exiting EU offers opportunity for UK to benefit from trade with other countries outside the EU.
However those in favour of Brexit fail to identify very real prospect that American could become very protectionist.
In assessing benefits of Brexit against real negatives of Brexit, UK government can only but proceed with extreme caution & wait until the election of next President of America & takes office to know for certain future benefits of Brexit.

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from political control. HM Government to set NHS budgets only.
attributes.background: The NHS should be run by a board of governors who are accountable to Parliament, like the BBC, with sensible targets, acceptable staffing levels and long-term plans. Politicians could then honestly debate the real issue, FUNDING, allowing a clear choice between parties which would interest voters.
attributes.additional_details: Constant reorganisation by politicians has damaged the NHS: it is divisive and saps energy, focus and productivity; there has been little time for benefits to show. Some change has been driven by political ideology from both sides without much clinical benefit. Governments only look 5 years ahead, until the next election. A quick fix for 5 years is no good. An independent but accountable, properly managed NHS would use research and sound experience to make plans for us all for the long term.

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18–25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Ban Air Guns
attributes.background: After a ricochet I was shot in the eye with an air pistol over 50 years ago and still being treated for the after effects, it has left me with partial sight that causes problems to this day.

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: teachers to get a comparable fine to parents should they strike in term time
attributes.background: If parents taking children out of school during term for holidays damages children's education then the mass shut down of the schooling system must be worse, so the fines would be even between anyone stopping the education of our children including teachers

attributes.action: Promise to match EU spending within the UK in the event of Brexit.
attributes.background: A large part of the campaign to leave the EU was based on the fact that the UK is a net contributor to the EU funds. We contribute £12.9bn a year (gross) or £7.1bn a year (net). In the event of Brexit, we would ask the government to maintain the level of investment in the UK that the EU contributed.
attributes.additional_details: The EU contributed £5.2bn a year to the UK, by various mechanisms. Given that in the event of Britain leaving the EU we will not be paying membership fees, we would ask that the government promise to maintain the payments that would have been made by the EU. This will, for example, protect vulnerable areas of the UK by matching the funding they would have received from the European development fund.

attributes.action: Add an option for "Protest / No Confidence" to all ballot voting options.
attributes.background: Rather than depending on spoiled ballot papers to count protest votes, introduce an official way for the voting public to express their democratic right to show that they have a political opinion, but they disagree with all the views of a campaign or political parties.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large number of the voting public who feel disenfranchised by our political parties and representatives, who feel like they have no representive or political voice. Spoiled ballot papers are not always clearly counted, and in the case of a referendum can be ignored completely. Having a specific option that allows the voting public to voice their desire to be involved, but that they are excluded from the current political parties, leaders or campaigns is essential for democracy.

attributes.action: Debate the rich poor divide, media bias and its effects on fear of immigration
attributes.background: We want parliament to move debates beyond the fear of migration and what to do about it. To the socio-economic background within which this fear is being nurtured and what to do about that. Including media coverage of the topic, tax avoidance-depriving the UK of revenue & the growing rich/ poor gap.
attributes.additional_details: Open and forward thinking discussion is urgently needed to re-dress the in balance of the economics of globalisation, money markets and the effects of private lobbying within Westminster by big business and private individuals. Trickle down is not working and wealth is pooling upwards instead. Leaving fewer resources for ever greater numbers of people world wide. I believe this is a root cause for the current fear of immigration in the UK which is being fuelled by facets of invested media.

attributes.action: British government should pay costs for 15 year plus ex pats to be EU citizens.
attributes.background: Ex pats that still hold a British passport and have been ex pats for 15 plus years in an EU land and were not allowed to vote in the EU rederendum should have the costs of changing citizenship to that of their current EU home, covered by the British Government.
attributes.additional_details: We had no say in the referendum but we may have to leave our EU homes due to stricter EU rules that may be imposed on British ex pats. This is undemocratic. A compensatory amount of no less than €1500,00 should me made available to any 15 year plus expat who chooses to revoke their British citizenship.  A separate arrangement should also be considered for any British State pension funds that may have accrued.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: Until Brexit Article 50 details are agreed, plans for HS2 should be put on hold.
attributes.background: The UK is undergoing considerable economic and financial strain. As this situation will continue, at least, until such time as all the EU severance details (Article 50) are worked through, the UK Government should put an immediate stop and hold on any further development of the HS2 project.

attributes.action: Potential employers must contact the applicant whether they're accepted or not
attributes.background: I've applied to jobs and although I have one currently, too many people will apply to jobs and receive no no input from the potential employer. To be forced to wait 2 weeks for a job you might not get, to be told you haven't got it after that waiting period is needed.

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action: Build new coal fired power stations using low carbon emission technology..
attributes.background:
We have learned that Germany will build new coal fired power stations despite urging us to close ours.
By re-opening the UK's coal mines and building new power stations utilising low carbon technology, we can secure our country's energy needs for the forseeable future.

attributes.action: Re-Nationalise British Steel Industry following Brexit.
attributes.background: It appears unlikely a private buyer will be found following Brexit and we cannot afford to lose these skills, jobs or rely on overseas mills to supply our steel.

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Parliamentary inquiry into deceitful claims to sway an election or referendum
attributes.background: The Brexit campaign dishonestly pledged £350 million per week for the NHS in full knowledge that this was was an impossibility.  This is just one example of a growing trend in British politics.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a growing tendency for candidates to field statements that they know to be wrong merely to gain a vote for their party or themselves.  Integrity is being eroded together with the high standards that once reflected British politics and decisions.  Can a successful vote won on the basis of deceit be democratically or morally valid?
I believe that it is time to openly discuss this problem through the proper vehicle of a parliamentary enquiry into such practices.

attributes.action: Hold binding referenda in cities/regions to vote on independence from the UK.
attributes.background: Post EU referendum 49% of the voting population are unhappy with the result. 2 countries and many large cities voted to stay, there is a massive divide in the politics, with fundamentally opposed ideas. The UK should allow these regions to vote on independence from the UK in binding referenda.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the uncertainty and issues that will arise from leaving the EU and new political leadership. We should seriously consider the alternative options available if cities or regions were to vote for independence and remain in the EU.

https://ig.ft.com/sites/elections/2016/uk/eu-referendum/
http://www.newsweek.com/london-sadiq-khan-brexit-londependence-independence-referendum-474356
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-36616028
http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36626201

attributes.action: Free public transport for teenagers.
attributes.background: Provide free public transport for teenagers (<20 years old). This will encourage green travel, reduce road fatalities and seriously injured for this age group and will help young job seekers to find work further from home without large travel cost burden.

attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create independent body to call re-elections if campaign promises are not kept
attributes.background:
Create an independent body to call snap elections/referendums, protecting our right to Democratic representation

Reverse the current trend of politicians basing campaigns on promises publicised to secure votes, then immediately discarded

Key promises must be identified+independently monitored
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign's pre-vote promises: 
https://goo.gl/DuYSZg

4 key promises retracted in first 24 hours: https://goo.gl/i83HYK

9 key pre-election promises broken by Tory Gov't in 1st 100 days: http://goo.gl/ZkgEqa

More pre-election promises immediately discarded: http://goo.gl/H3pnZM

If we are unable to vote on issues we want represented then we do not live in a functioning democracy

Intentions should be clearly stated as separate from promises. Promises should include dates for review

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age in referendums to 15 and elections to 16.
attributes.background: After the EU referendum I felt powerless to say my opinion because I am too young to vote. However many people at my school have a very large knowledge and definitely would've voted if they had the chance too. The people that these referendums impact the most aren't allowed to put forward their say.
